metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0337 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: The default configuration of nginx, possibly 1.3.13 and earlier, uses world-readable permissions for the (1) access.log and (2) error.log files, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading the files.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> The fix for CVE-2016-1247 in USN-3114-1 technically re-introduced this issue, but only for environments that configure non-default log filenames. Upstream will not be fixing the default permissions on log files. Marking this CVE as ignored, since the default configuration is not vulnerable and we will not be fixing this any further.

criterions.comment: nginx: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
